turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Texas Homeland Defense Service Medal.
turn.1: What is the ranking of Texas Homeland Defense Service Medal?
turn.2: Texas Homeland Defense Service Medal The Texas Homeland Defense Service Medal is the seventh highest campaign/service award that may be issued to a service member of the Texas Military Forces.
turn.3: What are the criteria that makes one eligible for the medal?
turn.4: The Texas Homeland Defense Service Medal is a one-time award to any member of the Texas Military Forces who: The Texas Homeland Defense Service Medal was established by Representative Dan Flynn in House Bill Number 2897, authorized by the Eightieth Texas Legislature, and approved by Governor Rick Perry on 15 June 2007, effective the same date.
turn.5: what does the medal look like?
turn.6: The pendant is a Texas Ranger style medal with a gold outer ring, with a minuteman centered on the star.
turn.7: What is inscribed on the medal?
turn.8: The gold outer ring is encircled by the words, “TEXAS HOMELAND DEFENSE SERVICE MEDAL”.
turn.9: What does the ribbon look like?
turn.10: The pendant is suspended by a ring from a silk moiré ribbon, 1-3/8 inches wide, composed of stripes of emerald green (15/32 of an inch), goldenrod (3/16 of an inch) and one azure blue (15/32 of an inch) in the center.
turn.11: What is attached to the ribbon?
turn.12: An enameled minuteman 3/8 of an inch wide in circumscribing diameter is centered on the ribbon.
